ygData.subject: Re: Server Emulator
ygData.msgSnippet: ... first emulator for EQ was a ... another emulator page.  They ... what it s worth, and oh ya- ...  I mean finish the ... I disagree on the
ygData.messageBody:
---srutkowski@... wrote:
>
> From: srutkowski@...
>
>
>
> Evidently (if you believe this other site) that
first emulator for EQ was a
> bunch of BS (not bloodstained). Here is a link to
another emulator page. They
> say 6 months more in development. Take that for
what it's worth, and oh ya-
> they need programmers to help start. . . . .
<cough cough> I mean finish the
> project.
>
> http://pog.drtwister.com/emudk/main.html
>
> Steve
>
I disagree on the first emulator being a bunch Of BS.
The guys that were doing are the same ones that did
it for Ultima Online. They posted the messages and
such that were sent back and forth between them and
Verant. They had screenshots of the thing in action.
And, according to them, they had been working on it
since the game was in beta because a few of them
managed to get into the testing of EQ. Origin had
left out a vital line in their software agreement
that allowed them to LAWFULLLY make the emulator.
Verant, howver, covered themseleves in their
agreement, which youhave to agree to to play the
game. The emulator was not a full functional thing
anyway... nor is the one for Ultima Onlline. For
instance.... none of the NPC quests were there... you
would have had to make your own via an editor like in
Ultima Online Emulator. The way they talked, EQ and
Ultima Online were both about the same as far as
making the emulators. I believed them. And, I just
think it is a matter of time before someone does it
just li9ke with Ultima Online. Someone will release
one not caring about Verant's threats.
-Kenny
